blog.name: tyrusoldme-am-spoilers
blog.title: Theodore James is the ONLY correct answer

summary: Real Talk
body:
Real Talk

TJ was horrible.

He was rude, shallow, sexist, selfish, and arrogant.

Then he met Cyrus. TJ was horrible because his insecurities got the better of him and they overwhelmed him, but he found someone to confide in: Cyrus- soon TJ was okay with being imperfect. He found someone to listen to him and genuinely care about him. He became kinder, more genuine, sweet, caring, apologetic (he’s getting better at it), and just overall a nicer and better person to everyone around him including Buffy.

Hate towards TJ shouldn’t exist. He redeemed himself and is now one of the most loved characters on the show and that’s the tea.

summary:
Look who’s getting emotional 
ME
(It’s long and unnecessary but I wanted to say it)
Even though I haven’t been here from the...
body:
Look who’s getting emotional

ME

(It’s long and unnecessary but I wanted to say it)


Even though I haven’t been here from the start, I am going to stay till the end and after it.

I started watching this series end of the july I think? (I had caught up with it after the sommersault episode aired). As a european one it was hell to find it online, at the end I managed to find a website and watched it, only left my room for food. After that I spent the rest of the summer being in the fandom, writing, drawing to sum up, being a fangirl. I met a lot of amazing people here <3

Andi Mack was on of the reasons I got up every day. I was reading andi mack fanfiction on my way school at 6:25am on the bus and getting weird looks when I started silently fangirlimg about the series and the connected works to it to my sister. Heck, I got a tons of funny look when I told about the story starting with Andi and Bex, the diversity the topics the characters and then finishing it with saying “it’s a disney channel series”

But Andi Mack is so much more than it seems. Always manages to surprise me. It’s so different yet it’s so familiar - I don’t know how to describe it. Whenever I have a bad day Andi Mack is one of those series I watch to make life a little bit more bearable.

In addition, Andi Mack was the first series I watched without english subs. I was so afraid if I would be able to understand it, and still when I watch an episode I am still afraid. Sometimes I had to rewatch the same scenes to truly capture what the characters were saying. But it doesn’t take from its value; every friday night I run in the house searching for a family member I can brag of it and they would just sit there and sigh like “new episode, right?” (it’s scary how much they know about the series just from me 😂)

I’m gonna be 18 in three days. And I’m proud I am a part of a fanbase for a disney channel show. Even if none in real life is gonna understand it. I am happy bc of this show <3
